notes.title: Java Basics Notes
notes.content:
Java Programming Basics:

1. Java is an object-oriented programming language
2. Platform independent - Write Once Run Anywhere (WORA)
3. Key features: Simple, Secure, Portable, Multithreaded

Basic Syntax:
- Every program must have a main method
- Class names should start with capital letter
- Method names should start with lowercase

notes.title: OOP Concepts
notes.content:
Object Oriented Programming Concepts:

1. Encapsulation: Binding data and methods together
2. Inheritance: Acquiring properties of parent class
3. Polymorphism: One interface, multiple implementations
4. Abstraction: Hiding implementation details
notes.description: Four pillars of Object Oriented Programming
